alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:05PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Localized strong wind gusts will impact portions of eastern Fremont and southern Teller Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 303 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking widely scattered showers and a couple of thunderstorms, capably of producing very isolated strong wind gusts. This activity extended along a line from near Cripple Creek to near Royal Gorge. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations potentially impacted include... Florence, Cripple Creek, Victor, Royal Gorge and Canon City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
